messages.title: WHO CARES MOST FOR OUR HEALTH SERVICE?

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Record health spending, over £12 billion. £383 million extra this year. 1,700 more nurses and midwives. 1,300 more consultants. 9,600 extra staff in total since 2006. Shorter waiting times. Rising patient satisfaction - better than any other part of the UK. Prescription charges scrapped.

issues.health: Record health spending, over £12 billion. £383 million extra this year. 1,700 more nurses and midwives. 1,300 more consultants. 9,600 extra staff in total since 2006. Shorter waiting times. Rising patient satisfaction - better than any other part of the UK. Prescription charges scrapped.

leaflet.personalStatement: Scotland's NHS is dear to the heart of everyone who lives here. For the last seven years in government we have worked hard to look after it. Now I'm determined to keep it safe from the privatisation agenda of the Westminster parties and the knock-on threat to funding in Scotland. With strong SNP voices in Westminster we can protect our health service. And, in Scotland, we'll never stop doing our best to make our NHS healthier still.
